title: Help with a gothic, please.
content:
I have literally been trying all weekend to identify this face, and I can’t do it. I know I will feel like an idiot once you experts nail it, because I feel like I should know it. Any help would be much appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084200im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Pro_4497.gif)

 [‹ Type ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084200/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46913 "Go to previous forum topic") [odd serif font with curlicues type ID...? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084200/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46894 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content: To me, this looks like Palatino. I did some experimenting with the phrase and that’s the closest I can get, but it’s not a true match. I may not have this font installed, but I’m guessing it’s Palatino or some other light typeface.
There’s another font in Microsoft Works called Malgun Gothic. The Cs and Gs seem closer than Palatino.
Thanks. I’m not familiar with that font, so I’m glad I turned to you!
